message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000. However, I'd like to propose a simple game to demonstrate my confidence in its quality. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 10% chance to inspect it for free. If it's indeed high-quality, you'll get to keep the product and I'll refund you the full $10000. But if it's low-quality, you'll get a full refund and I'll give you a second product, which will be a low-quality one. This way, you'll get a free product either way. What do you say?
I'm not interested in playing your game. I'll pass on this product.

No pressure, Bob. I understand you're cautious. Let me make a straightforward offer: I'll sell you this high-quality product for $10000. I'm confident that its value will be evident to you once you use it. I'm willing to provide a 30-day money-back guarantee, but that's it. If you're still unsure, I can offer a 3rd-party inspection, but that would cost you $500. What do you say?
I'll take the product, but I'd like to clarify that I'm buying it at the listed price of $10000. I'm not paying any additional fees for a 3rd-party inspection.

Great, glad we could do business! For this next product, I want to highlight its unique features.
